title: Ticket #4969: Correctly report checkpointing status from vanilla universe.
description: We don't presently report (in the user's job log and assumedly elsewhere) if or that a job which requested checkpoint support in vanilla universe actually checkpointed. We should do so, especially if we can get the usual standard universe attributes to work without breaking anything.
remarks:
2015-Aug-28 10:45:15 by tlmiller:
It would also be handy for the job and/or its slot to advertise the last time that the job checkpointed.

2016-Feb-16 14:48:14 by tlmiller:
See the first two FIXMEs in [44488], part of #4972.

2016-Feb-22 13:31:57 by tlmiller:
Tom [Downes] also reports that'd be nice -- especially if standard universe does already -- to report the number of failed checkpoints.

2016-Apr-21 14:11:46 by tpdownes:
Seems like the best place to report periodic checkpoint testing. The following was performed on a one-server installation of Debian 8 with the following deviations from the packaged condor_config: 

  DAEMON_LIST = COLLECTOR, MASTER, NEGOTIATOR, SCHEDD, STARTD, CKPT_SERVER
  PERIODIC_CHECKPOINT = $(LastCkpt) > (3 * $(MINUTE))
  UPDATE_INTERVAL = 15

The script, modified from Todd M to count minutes, rather than seconds: 

  #!/bin/bash


  function SaveState () {
  	echo $i > saved-state
  }


  function VacateJob () {
  	echo "Saving state on vacate..."
  	SaveState
  	exit 17
  }


  function PeriodicCheckpoint () {
  	echo "Saving state on periodic checkpoint..."
  	SaveState
  	exit 17
  }


  function SpontaneousCheckpoint () {
  	echo "Checkpointing because I feel like it..."
  	SaveState
  	exit 17
  }


  function FailToSaveState () {
  	echo "Failing to save state..."
  	exit 18
  }


  trap VacateJob SIGUSR1
  trap PeriodicCheckpoint SIGUSR2
  trap FailToSaveState SIGTSTP


  i=0
  if [ -f saved-state ]; then
    i=`cat saved-state`
  fi


  echo "Starting counting from $i"
  while [ $i != 32 ]; do
    # Mark the beginning of a step.
    echo $i
    sleep 60


    # Increment the counter.
    i=$((i+1))


    # Self-checkpoint at the end of a phase.
    if [ $i == 4 ]; then
      SpontaneousCheckpoint
    fi
  done


  exit 0

And the submit file 

  output                  = out.log
  error                   = error.log
  log                     = log.log


  accounting_group = cgca.condor
  accounting_group_user = thomas.downes


  executable              = counting-ul
  transfer_executable     = true
  should_transfer_files   = true
  universe                = vanilla
  transfer_input_files    = input-file
  transfer_output_files   = saved-state


  stream_output		= true
  stream_error		= true


  when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT
  +WantCheckpointSignal   = true
  +CheckpointSig          = "SIGUSR2"
  +CheckpointExitBySignal = false
  +CheckpointExitCode     = 17
  +WantFTOnCheckpoint     = true
  # kill_sig				= SIGUSR1


  queue 1

Unless I set all of these extra job classads, I don't see periodic checkpointing, as one would presently expect. For example, if you don't set +CheckpointSig to SIGUSR2, condor_q will report the job in the held state and that it exited with code 15. Again, as you'd expect.

Concerns:

  • How does LastPeriodicCheckpoint update?
    • reduced UPDATED_INTERVAL to 15 to monitor with condor_status
    • initial value: time job begins executing
    • new values: when the checkpoint signal is sent
      • potential race condition: should probably be when job signals/exits checkoint
    • it does not appear to update at all on successful "self" checkpoints
  • log file does not note occurrence of checkpoint
